A pool of still, clear water fills the pedestal's concave. The closer you stand, the more inviting the water seems.

The essence you possess pulsates gently, drawing you nearer to the basin.

Violent ripples mar the surface of the water. The water at your feet begins to foam and churn.

Then, abruptly, the water stops. It begins flowing in the opposite direction.
The essence in your hand continues to pull toward the basin of water. Perhaps touching the essence to the water again will reverse the water's flow.
A pool of still, clear water fills the pedestal's concave. The closer you stand, the more inviting the water seems.
The surface of the water offers no resistance. Nothing happens.
You dip your cupped hand in the water and bring it to your lips. The water is refreshing, but otherwise unremarkable.
